main event: A civilian reported a sighting of a blue cross in the sky on 9th July 1952 near Portland, Oregon. The object was observed for 4-5 seconds, traveling in a north-east direction.
interesting points: The report was received from a civilian source, adding credibility to the sighting.
The observation was categorized as an optical-visual type.
The document also includes an internal military communication requesting information on all sightings within a 20-minute period of the reported sighting.
An additional report from Parksville, MO, described a dark ball in the sky with a trailing fire tail and flashes, observed for approximately 32 minutes.
The document follows the declassification protocol, indicating its initial classified status due to the nature of the report.
